comments:
Using the graphical wsdl editor, I have imported another schema.  When I expand
the "greyed out" imported messages, and try to edit that schema graph appearing
to the right two error messages get logged (for example right click and try to
change the type of an element).

and 

Error 2005-02-21 17:01:59.515 Unhandled event loop exception



It makes sense that you should not be able to edit these "greyed out" items
since they are imported from another file, so maybe there should be no context menu.

After I get this error anytime I click on a non-imported (coloured black) item
in the graph view I get an error message.  These errors seem to keep occuring
until I reopen the editor.

More generally, this seems to be happening anytime you edit the schema
componenet from this view.  It can make editing difficult with so many errors
dialogs popping up.
this seems to be fixed in a recent build

Context menu still enabled for imported XSD Schema objects.  They should be 
greyed out.
I believe this is fixed now.  Mark, can you verify.
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
